Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Why are you using a fixed size buffer instead of vasprintf?

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Use __attribute__ ((format (printf, 1, 2))) before the opening brace to make the compiler understand you are defining a printf wrapper :).

Author: Tony Crisci
Comment:
When I was looking up how to do this, there were many grave warnings about "buffer overflow attacks" (which I don't know much about) that your code could be exposed to without a fixed buffer.

From what I understand, it is good practice to use a fixed buffer when handling text from an outside source, such as the yajl error message.
